property.name: text
property.value: Author: Christopher Brooks, based on ModalModel by Edward A. Lee

property.name: text
property.value: This modal model has two modes, "clean" and "noisy". In the "clean" mode, it generates samples of a clean (noiseless) sinusoid at regular sample intervals. In the "noisy" mode, it generates a noisy sinusoid. It switches modes at random times according to a Poisson process.

property.name: text
property.value: Right click on the ModalModel and select "Open Actor" to see how this model works.

property.name: text
property.value: Right click on the InstanceOfSRSinewave and select "Open Instance" to see how we modified the Sinewave Actor Oriented Class.

property.name: text
property.value:
This model is based on de/demo/ModalModel/ModalModel.xml. The purpose of this model is to exercise the SRDirector.clone() method.
The SRSinewave is a duplicate of Sinewave that uses an SRDirector instead of a SDFDirector.
In theory, we should be able to override the SDFDirector in the instance by dragging in a SRDirector, but that did not work.

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

property.name: text
property.value: Mode switches are triggered by the presence of an "event" input. On each transition, the phase of the sinusoid is updated in the refinement of the destination state so that the phase is continuous. An alternative design would have put the Ramp outside the modal model.

property.name: text
property.value: Each bubble represents a "mode" of operation of this modal component. Each mode has a "refinement" which gives the behavior of the component when the component is in this mode. In the Debug menu, you can turn on animation to view the mode switching.

property.name: text
property.value: Look inside the states to see the mode refinements.

property.name: text
property.value: In this mode, the model simply passes the data from the input to the output without any modification.

property.name: text
property.value: In this mode, the model adds Gaussian noise to the signal.

entity.name: Gaussian
entity.doc: Create a sequence of gaussian random variables
